item.title: Lock please (Fixed)
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

$conn = mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die("Error: " mysql_error());

should be

$conn = mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die("Error: " . mysql_error());

Read full topic

item.title: Lock please (Fixed)

item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“chrham2, post:7, topic:263556”]i just dont understand this

CREATE TABLE login (
ID mediumint(9) AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
username varchar(100),
password varchar(40),
email varchar(100)
)[/quote]That’s the SQL part. Use it to setup a table in your SQL database.

item.title: Lock please (Fixed)
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

[quote=“chrham2, post:5, topic:263556”][quote author=Server-Unknown.Net link=topic=348099.msg2678786#msg2678786 date=1235247222]

Hi! I want a tutorial on how to create a Register & Login in php, without MySQL since i dont know how to host a mySql database.

<?php // You gotta connect through php in order to get connect with mysql so heres how, i explain in detail too: $dbhost = "localhost"; // this the host for your database, like www.localhost.com or your website give you a host $dbname = "whatsdatabasename"; // this going to be your database name where you store all your tables to operate your site $dbuser = "root"; // root is usually the localhost username so we use that instead, but it depends on your hoster, they will explain that too you though $dbpass = ""; // since username to access database is root on localhost we have no pass, thats usually empty if your using a php host on your computer (like wamp/xampp), but your host will tell you the pass once you subscribe to them $conn = mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die("Error: " mysql_error()); // this is where we actually connect to mysql, we put variables into it to supply info for host, username, and password. if it dont connect it going to display mysql_error() $result = mysql_connect_db($dbname); // all this does is select the database 'whatsdatabasename' ?>

Now all you do after that is go to page and it will set up the database in phpmyadmin or w/e you use… then you can see in you database to see if its set up, and BAM! You just connected like ant eyes!
[/quote]
Well, how can i turn this into a Register & login form?[/quote]

You basically said you don’t know PHP…

Theres a tutorials I’m using now on Combined Minds that you can see [url=http://www.combined-minds.net/tutorials/53/Creating_a_user_login_and_registration_system]here[url]. And if you get stuck just come back and ask the question, but if you dont know php you in bad luck cuz I cant tell you much, not a php expert :o…

Read full topic

item.title: Lock please (Fixed)
item.dc:creator: @chrham2 chrham2
item.description:
@chrham2 wrote:

[quote=“Server-Unknown.Net, post:4, topic:263556”][quote author=chrham2 link=topic=348099.msg2678664#msg2678664 date=1235240310]
Hi! I want a tutorial on how to create a Register & Login in php, without MySQL since i dont know how to host a mySql database.
[/quote]

<?php // You gotta connect through php in order to get connect with mysql so heres how, i explain in detail too: $dbhost = "localhost"; // this the host for your database, like www.localhost.com or your website give you a host $dbname = "whatsdatabasename"; // this going to be your database name where you store all your tables to operate your site $dbuser = "root"; // root is usually the localhost username so we use that instead, but it depends on your hoster, they will explain that too you though $dbpass = ""; // since username to access database is root on localhost we have no pass, thats usually empty if your using a php host on your computer (like wamp/xampp), but your host will tell you the pass once you subscribe to them $conn = mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die("Error: " mysql_error()); // this is where we actually connect to mysql, we put variables into it to supply info for host, username, and password. if it dont connect it going to display mysql_error() $result = mysql_connect_db($dbname); // all this does is select the database 'whatsdatabasename' ?>

Now all you do after that is go to page and it will set up the database in phpmyadmin or w/e you use… then you can see in you database to see if its set up, and BAM! You just connected like ant eyes![/quote]
Well, how can i turn this into a Register & login form?

Read full topic

item.title: Lock please (Fixed)
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

chrham2:

Hi! I want a tutorial on how to create a Register & Login in php, without MySQL since i dont know how to host a mySql database.

<?php // You gotta connect through php in order to get connect with mysql so heres how, i explain in detail too: $dbhost = "localhost"; // this the host for your database, like www.localhost.com or your website give you a host $dbname = "whatsdatabasename"; // this going to be your database name where you store all your tables to operate your site $dbuser = "root"; // root is usually the localhost username so we use that instead, but it depends on your hoster, they will explain that too you though $dbpass = ""; // since username to access database is root on localhost we have no pass, thats usually empty if your using a php host on your computer (like wamp/xampp), but your host will tell you the pass once you subscribe to them $conn = mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die("Error: " mysql_error()); // this is where we actually connect to mysql, we put variables into it to supply info for host, username, and password. if it dont connect it going to display mysql_error() $result = mysql_connect_db($dbname); // all this does is select the database 'whatsdatabasename' ?>

Now all you do after that is go to page and it will set up the database in phpmyadmin or w/e you use… then you can see in you database to see if its set up, and BAM! You just connected like ant eyes!

Read full topic
